column1: You may have this procedure if you have: - Macular degeneration: An eye disorder that slowly destroys sharp, central vision - Macular edema: Swelling or thickening of the macula, the part of your eye that provides sharp, central vision - Diabetic retinopathy, which can cause new, abnormal blood vessels to grow in the retina, the back part of your eye - Swelling and inflammation within the eyeball (uveitis) - Retinal vein occlusion: A blockage of the veins that carry blood away from the retina and out of the eye - Infections in the inside of the eye (endophthalmitis)

They may include: - Increased pressure in the eye - Inflammation - Bleeding - Damage to the retina or surrounding nerves or structures - Infection - Vision loss - Loss of the eye (very rare) - Side effects from the medicines that are used Discuss the risks of specific medicines used in your eye with your provider.
